description: Change of use of existing building from a doctors surgery (D1 Use) to a 1x3 bed dwelling house (Class C3 Use) with associated car parking, amenity space and refuse facilities
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s)/references: Location Plan, Proposed and Existing Block Plan (Rev A), Proposed Floor plans (Rev A) and Existing Floor Plans, and additional Supporting Information.   REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the criteria specified at the SPG 10, as adopted by the London Borough of Ealing, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, and the BS4142 rating noise.  The details shall also include the building envelope noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and attenuation of building services plant.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan, and The London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.6 and 7.15. | Details shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Church Road, Northolt facade. The supply is to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before the unit is occupied.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan, and The London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.6 and 7.14. | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first beneficial occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | The new residential unit hereby permitted shall comply with Lifetime Homes standards prior to its first occupation and shall be retained as such thereafter.      Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with Lifetime Homes Standards and policies 3.8 and 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the beneficial occupation of the development hereby approved, details of cycle stands within a secure and undercover area for two bicycles in compliance with the Manual for Streets Guidance shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. The cycle store shall be installed within one month of this detail being discharged and retained permanently.  Reason: To ensure that the development provides suitable cycle parking provision in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2011).
